revised_title: Spectrum of Active Nitrogen and the Origin of Cyanogen Spectrum
tldr: The author investigates the spectrum of the afterglow that occurs when active nitrogen reverts to ordinary nitrogen. They discover that the green, yellow, and red bands in the spectrum are actually a selection of the first positive bands of nitrogen. The author also examines the effect of adding helium to nitrogen and finds that the cyanogen spectrum disappears when a trace of oxygen is introduced, suggesting that hydrocyanic acid is formed in the process.
